column7: You did not support waste tax

column3: A homeless person asks for 500 euros. Give him money or send him to the shelter?
column5: Send him to the homeless shelter
column7: You help him get to the shelter, where he tells everyone about how good you are.

column3: A newspaper wants to write an article about you. Would you give a full interview or rather do your job?
column5: Answer a few questions and get back to work
column7: You answer a few quick questions and get back to work.

column3: A new autonomous car company asks for your support.
column6: The company donates 1000 to your budget.
column7: The company organizes a facebook event and notes that you did not support them.

column3: A new business asks for policies allowing them to create more jobs.
column5: Ask them to support your party
column6: You push the policies and the business donates to your party
column7: You ask the company for donations, but an investigative journalist finds out. A public scandal

column3: A group of environmentalists wants more green areas in the city
column4: Suggest it to the city officials
column5: Tell them you will suggest it, but do nothing
column6: You use part of your budget to help the environmentalists
column7: You do nothing, the environmentalists are disappointed

column3: Is there a problem in your neighborhood such as speeding or graffiti? Would you try to solve it?
column6: You initiate a campaign for removing graffiti.

column3: What activities for kids after school would you propose?
column6: The city hall invests in sports activities
column7: The city hall invests in books for the local library

column3: Do you want to know what recreation classes are available at your neighborhood center?
column6: City hall pushes new recreation classes.
column7: The public requires more recreation classes

column3: Is a new park or library needed in your part of the city?
Are you wondering what is being done about homelessness?
column4: Yes and we will do something about it.
column5: Yes, but we do not have the budget for it now.
column6: You are concerned and you organize an initiative to donate clothes and shelter to homeless people

column3: Do the potholes on your street need repair?
column6: A few of the holes are repaired fast.
column7: You will take care of them later

column3: Are there questions about our city's operations that you want answers to?
column4: Yes, there are a lot of questions we need to ask
column5: I believe city hall is doing its job perfectly fine

column3: Polls show most voters don't think government works. Would you fight to prove them wrong or support their claims?
column5: I try to convince them that government works
column6: People dislike the fact that you support their claims, but do nothing about it
column7: You explain to people your opinion and they like your sincerity

column3: Do you think eliminating obsolete laws, regulations and bureaucracies would help to reduce the federal budget deficit by cutting waste and saving time?
One way to improve public education without spending more money is to cut the bureaucracy and red tape that makes it difficult for principals and teachers to do their jobs.
Do you support a new coal plant, which would create a lot of new jobs or a new automated factory, which would be environmentally friendly?
Elon Musk wants to construct a hyperloop train connected to your city. It would be an expensive venture, but it will greatly benefit your people.
column5: It is too expensive. Maybe some other time
